beans.description:
This adaptor does the following...
* connects to Sybase based exception processor * executes SQL against the exception schema
It is designed to illustrate the basic structure of an adaptor that retrieves exceptions from a database. See sybase-hospital-writer.xml for an example of how to generate exceptions in the Sybase based exception processor.
Run it like this...
java org.openadaptor.spring.SpringAdaptor -config sybase-exception-reader.xml -props sybase.properties
You need the following in your classpath
lib lib/openadaptor.jar lib/openadaptor-spring.jar lib/openadaptor-depends.jar <Sybase Driver>
Once running, errors stored in the hospital will be printed to the console.

bean.description: Reader which polls database using configured SQL.

property.name: sql
property.value: select ID, TIMESTAMP, DATA, EXCEPTION_CLASS_NAME, EXCEPTION_MESSAGE, CAUSE_EXCEPTION_CLASS_NAME, CAUSE_EXCEPTION_MESSAGE, ADAPTOR_NAME, ORIGINATING_COMPONENT, THREAD_NAME, DATA_TYPE from OA_Exception where FIXED = 'true' and REPROCESSED = 'false'

property.name: postReadSql
property.value: update OA_Exception set REPROCESSED='true' where FIXED = 'true' and REPROCESSED = 'false'
